pattern.name: Clinical Empathy
pattern.core_dynamic: Third-person limited access through medical perspective combines with objective yet compassionate stance to create therapeutic distance that enables deeper understanding of trauma.
pattern.reader_effect: Readers experience psychological wounds through both clinical observation and intimate consciousness, creating intellectual comprehension paired with emotional resonance.

voice.pov_description: Third person limited primarily through Rivers' perspective with occasional shifts to other characters
voice.focalization_description: Internal focalization through characters' consciousness, especially Rivers and Sassoon

structure.plot_architecture_description: Single plot following the treatment relationships at Craiglockhart Hospital

voice.tone: Clinical yet empathetic, exploring psychological trauma with medical precision and human compassion

device_mediation.summary: Devices mediate alignment through clinical observation and psychological realism, using dialogue, internal monologue, and symbolic imagery to reveal the complex dynamics between doctor and patient, challenging conventional notions of sanity, duty, and healing in wartime

micro_devices.name: Third-Person Limited
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Rivers watched him for a while
micro_devices.scene: Rivers observing Sassoon during their therapeutic session
micro_devices.effect: Creates clinical empathy by filtering Sassoon's trauma through Rivers's medical perspective, maintaining therapeutic distance while enabling compassionate understanding

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: like trying to stop the ship would have been
micro_devices.scene: Sassoon describing throwing his MC into the Mersey
micro_devices.effect: Transforms personal trauma into objective imagery that Rivers can clinically assess while preserving the emotional truth of Sassoon's futile gesture

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: You seem to have a very powerful anti-war neurosis
micro_devices.scene: Rivers's diagnostic conclusion about Sassoon
micro_devices.effect: Places medical terminology against political conviction, demonstrating how clinical perspective reframes moral stance as psychological condition

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: twisted and blackened shapes began to seem like old friends
micro_devices.scene: Sassoon's memory of corpses before Arras
micro_devices.effect: Transforms horrific war imagery into familiar, almost comforting details, showing how clinical distance enables processing of unbearable trauma

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Like a trench without the sky
micro_devices.scene: Description of Craiglockhart's top corridor
micro_devices.effect: Hospital architecture becomes symbol of psychological entrapment, using clinical observation to reveal deeper truths about patient experience

micro_devices.name: Dialogue
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Do you think I'm mad?
micro_devices.scene: Sassoon's direct question to Rivers
micro_devices.effect: Creates therapeutic exchange where clinical expertise meets patient vulnerability, establishing the healing dynamic through professional discourse

micro_devices.name: Foreshadowing
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: it's my duty to try to change that
micro_devices.scene: Rivers explaining his role to Sassoon
micro_devices.effect: Establishes the therapeutic tension between doctor's duty and patient's conviction, previewing the clinical challenge of treating principled dissent

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: This may come as a shock, Dr Rivers, but I had been rather assuming that we were not.
micro_devices.scene: Prior and Rivers in therapy session discussing their adversarial relationship
micro_devices.effect: Places doctor-patient therapeutic alliance against Prior's resistance, creating clinical distance that reveals the deeper power dynamics of treatment

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: thin line of khaki was just visible beneath the purple silk
micro_devices.scene: Owen observing Sassoon in his dressing gown during their first meeting
micro_devices.effect: Military uniform beneath civilian luxury symbolizes the war's inescapable presence even in recovery, enabling objective assessment of trauma's permanence

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: skulls in the side. You looked back along and … Like mushrooms.
micro_devices.scene: Owen describing ancient trenches to Sassoon
micro_devices.effect: Visceral sensory detail creates therapeutic distance through metaphorical transformation of trauma into observable phenomena

micro_devices.name: Foreshadowing
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: A hundred years from now they'll still be ploughing up skulls.
micro_devices.scene: Sassoon sharing his vision of the war's lasting impact
micro_devices.effect: Projects trauma's permanence into future perspective, allowing clinical examination of war's enduring psychological effects

micro_devices.name: Third-Person Limited
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Anderson, following Sassoon into the bar of the golf club, knew he owed him an apology.
micro_devices.scene: Anderson's internal struggle after his violent outburst on the golf course
micro_devices.effect: Provides clinical access to Anderson's psychological state while maintaining therapeutic objectivity about his suppressed violence

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: It's like a very deep voice saying, Run along, little man.
micro_devices.scene: Owen describing the ancient, inevitable nature of war
micro_devices.effect: Transforms overwhelming trauma into analyzable metaphor, creating distance that enables understanding of war's psychological impact

micro_devices.name: Dialogue
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: I don't write about that. I s-suppose I've always thought of p-poetry as the opposite of all that.
micro_devices.scene: Owen explaining why he doesn't write war poetry to Sassoon
micro_devices.effect: Reveals character's psychological defense mechanisms through natural speech, allowing clinical observation of trauma avoidance

micro_devices.name: Third-Person Limited
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: He wasn't surprised, he assumed Orme had come
micro_devices.scene: Sassoon's hallucination of dead soldier Orme in his room
micro_devices.effect: Creates therapeutic distance by filtering traumatic experience through clinical observation while maintaining access to psychological state

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: the two bloody bargains on which a civilization
micro_devices.scene: Rivers examining church window depicting crucifixion and Abraham's sacrifice
micro_devices.effect: Uses religious imagery to clinically analyze societal structures that sacrifice youth, creating objective framework for understanding trauma's origins

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: the inheritors were dying, not one by one
micro_devices.scene: Rivers contrasting dying soldiers with civilians singing hymns
micro_devices.effect: Places clinical observation of mass death alongside domestic comfort to highlight the gap between trauma and civilian understanding

micro_devices.name: Flashback
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: A memory tweaked the edges of his mind
micro_devices.scene: Sassoon remembering childhood mirror and father's departure
micro_devices.effect: Provides clinical context for current abandonment feelings while maintaining therapeutic distance through structured recall

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: His fingers dug through the fluffiness into surprisingly
micro_devices.scene: Rivers handling chickens with physical discomfort
micro_devices.effect: Creates visceral sensory details that mirror clinical examination of uncomfortable realities while maintaining objective stance

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: little Atlases struggling to hold up the world
micro_devices.scene: Rivers remembering chicks hatching by the fire
micro_devices.effect: Transforms clinical observation into compassionate understanding of vulnerability and struggle, embodying therapeutic empathy

micro_devices.name: Foreshadowing
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: he found it difficult to envisage any future
micro_devices.scene: Rivers thinking about writing to David Burns about his future
micro_devices.effect: Clinical assessment masked as casual observation hints at deeper understanding of trauma's long-term effects

micro_devices.name: Motif
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: stammering boys, any age from ten to nineteen
micro_devices.scene: Rivers remembering his father's speech therapy pupils
micro_devices.effect: Recurring theme of communication breakdown connects personal history to current therapeutic work, maintaining clinical yet empathetic perspective

micro_devices.name: Third-Person Limited
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Rivers thought how misleading it was
micro_devices.scene: Rivers observing Burns during their evening conversation about Suffolk
micro_devices.effect: Provides medical perspective on Burns's condition while maintaining therapeutic distance through clinical observation of his psychological state

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: a toothless mouth mumbling pebbles
micro_devices.scene: Rivers and Burns walking along the beach at night
micro_devices.effect: Creates clinical imagery that transforms the natural environment into something that reflects trauma and decay, maintaining objective yet compassionate stance

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: prematurely aged man and a fossilized schoolboy
micro_devices.scene: Rivers analyzing Burns's psychological state during their conversation
micro_devices.effect: Presents clinical assessment of trauma's effects through contrasting elements, enabling deeper understanding through medical perspective

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: tangles of barbed wire that ran
micro_devices.scene: The beach walk where Burns seems oblivious to the war defenses
micro_devices.effect: War intrudes into peaceful setting while Burns appears not to see it, symbolizing his suppression and creating therapeutic distance for analysis

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: bones of Burns's face gleaming
micro_devices.scene: Walking on the beach in moonlight
micro_devices.effect: Medical imagery emphasizes physical manifestation of trauma while maintaining objective observation that enables compassionate understanding

micro_devices.name: Internal Monologue
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Why do I go along with it?
micro_devices.scene: Rivers working on his paper while Burns sits by the fire
micro_devices.effect: Provides clinical self-examination that combines medical perspective with therapeutic questioning, creating distance that enables deeper understanding

micro_devices.name: Foreshadowing
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: But then why am I here?
micro_devices.scene: Rivers wondering about the real reason for his invitation
micro_devices.effect: Medical intuition suggests underlying issues despite surface improvement, maintaining clinical empathy that anticipates deeper therapeutic needs

micro_devices.name: Motif
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: the nightmare followed
micro_devices.scene: Rivers hearing Burns's disturbed sleep despite daytime improvement
micro_devices.effect: Recurring trauma pattern observed through medical lens, providing objective evidence that enables compassionate understanding of suppression's limits

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: a grotesque parody of Adam naming created things
micro_devices.scene: Rivers walking on the Heath, haunted by images of Callan's treatment
micro_devices.effect: Creates clinical distance by intellectualizing the trauma through biblical comparison, enabling therapeutic understanding of the dehumanizing treatment

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: An instrument of control
micro_devices.scene: Rivers analyzing his dream about the horse's bit
micro_devices.effect: The bit symbolizes systematic control mechanisms in therapy, allowing clinical examination of power dynamics while maintaining compassionate distance

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: the moist, pink interior, the delicately quivering uvula
micro_devices.scene: Rivers' nightmare about forcing an electrode into a patient's mouth
micro_devices.effect: Visceral medical imagery creates therapeutic distance through clinical precision while revealing the violence beneath treatment

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: recovery meant the resumption of activities that were not merely self-destructive but positively suicidal
micro_devices.scene: Rivers reflecting on the paradox of psychiatric treatment during wartime
micro_devices.effect: Contrasts healing with harm to enable clinical analysis of therapeutic contradictions with empathetic understanding

micro_devices.name: Dramatic Irony
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Perhaps Callan remembered, as Yealland apparently did not, that Mons had been a defeat
micro_devices.scene: Yealland calling Callan 'a hero of Mons' during treatment
micro_devices.effect: Creates knowing distance between medical observer and practitioner, enabling critical yet compassionate evaluation of treatment methods

micro_devices.name: Internal Monologue
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: There is no distinction
micro_devices.scene: Rivers analyzing his dream and its accusation about his methods
micro_devices.effect: Enables therapeutic self-examination through clinical introspection, maintaining professional distance while achieving deeper understanding
